svg:

If you write code in such a way that each code module (class, method, etc.) is tightly focused on doing one thingwell (a.k.a. the "Unix Philosophy") you get some good things and some not so good things.- Good things: Cohesion, possibility of reuse, easy of replacing things (instead of changing them), ability to test more thoroughly, easily, etc.- Bad Things: Harder to understand easily, nothing on it's own can do much. Needs collaborators. If you aren't careful, coupling will be an isssue.
